name: Avoid weak encryption algorithm (Objective-C)
description: This rule will check the value used to define the algorithm
output:
This report lists all uses of CCCrypt function call
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale:
Insecure use of cryptography is common in most mobile apps that leverage encryption. There are two fundamental ways that broken cryptography is manifested within mobile apps. First, the mobile app may use a process behind the encryption/decryption that is fundamentally flawed and can be exploited by the adversary to decrypt sensitive data. Second, the mobile app may implement or leverage an encryption/decryption​ algorithm that is weak in nature and can be directly decrypted by the adversary.

When using the CCCrypt function, you must provide an encryption algorithm. Antiquated encryption algorithms, especially those that use keys of insufficient size, no longer provide sufficient protection for use with sensitive data, as technological advancements have made it computationally feasible to obtain small encryption keys through brute-force in a reasonable amount of time.
remediation: Better to use the value kCCAlgorithmAES128 instead of kCCAlgorithmDES, kCCAlgorithm3DES, kCCAlgorithmCAST, kCCAlgorithmRC4
remediationSample:
CCCrypt(kCCEncrypt,
        kCCAlgorithmAES128,
        kCCOptionPKCS7Padding,
        key,
        kCCKeySizeAES128, // 128-bit key size
        iv,
        plaintext,
        sizeof(plaintext),
        ciphertext,
        sizeof(ciphertext),
        &numBytesEncrypted);
sample:
CCCrypt(kCCEncrypt,
        kCCAlgorithmDES,
        kCCOptionPKCS7Padding,
        key,
        kCCKeySizeDES, // 64-bit key size
        iv,
        plaintext,
        sizeof(plaintext),
        ciphertext,
        sizeof(ciphertext),
        &numBytesEncrypted);
alternativeName: Ensure you use the value kCCAlgorithmAES128 instead of kCCAlgorithmDES, kCCAlgorithm3DES, kCCAlgorithmCAST, kCCAlgorithmRC4
